intro: Galium sylvestre f. commutatum, commonly known as the woodland bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape and have a slightly serrated margin. This variety is native to parts of Europe and is often found in shaded, moist woodland environments.
